alert.note: Alert for Coastal Del Norte; Northern Humboldt Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 20 at 9:17PM PST until February 22 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TUESDAY TO 7 PM PST WEDNESDAY BELOW 1000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON BELOW 1000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory below 1000 feet, hail and snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch below 1000 feet, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of up to 4 inches possible. * WHERE...Coastal Del Norte and Northern Humboldt Coast Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 1 PM Tuesday to 7 PM PST Wednesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday evening through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and hail accumulating on area roadways will result in hazardous driving conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Del Norte; Northern Humboldt Coast
